aR5ffJNLCwvtZChTUtVm2A.text: Wasn't the best experience. The Custormer service was terrible and the food was over priced for the quality.

vRMMZHtaLlz9hjyYGeLjeg.text: I absolutely love this place! I have been here a few times and it's always been a great experience! Today, however, was even greater, it was the BEST! Maya was a GEM! She went above and beyond as I was getting some goods for my friend. She was so nice, super attentive, and she truly loves her job, you can just tell. This coffee shop should be so grateful to have such an awesome barista.

nZYpM4B01Wy2QyDXbZWzEg.text: Very cool coffee place with the total ambiance of the old train depot. Someone has put a lot of thought into small details. I was a bit disappointed with the breakfast omelette. It just was bland and no garnish offered. Salsa would have softened and added to the overall taste.

TEZmCjDjEeqQuuMYCXJ9kg.text: This is going to be the worst review I've ever written. I've been coming to this cafe now for over a month at least 3 times a week. Over the course of the past 2 weeks I've had to wait over 5 min or so for someone to take my order let alone acknowledge me. There's only really 2 people there that actually remember me which is sad. Seeing that their never really that busy when I'm there. So today as I sit in my normal spot without even have ordered. I watch from a distance as the only girl serving people is still engaged in a conversation that has lasted over 10 min. That's 15 min. That I a paying customer still hasn't been acknowledged. Not only is she not aware of her surroundings she's taken the liberty to use a cooler as a chair at the window bar. If I was the owner of this establishment I would fire her on that accord alone. I don't pay you to sit! Lol..it also seems like if I was to border alcohol I would get immediate service. Seeing that's the only clientele she's engaging with. So as I walk out now unserved to another business that's willing to except my hard earned cash. I challenge Charlie the owner to rectify the situation or I will assume that my business or anyone else that cares business is not needed for your establishment...it suxks because I really do like this place too..  Signed Chef...

jgXw8CDff3UzrmBq8yJk4A.text: Coffee and food here are ridiculously good . Ambiance is exactly where it needs to be and everyone here seems to enjoy their job . You wanna vibey place with good energy to match ... Come here

4jWGhuEIApr5mMccza-jlQ.text: I have never had to wait 20 minutes for an americano before. It's just espresso and water?! How long does that take?! Amazing. If you don't have 20 minutes to wait for 1 drink, avoid this place at all costs. Also it wasn't even busy.

ePuUs1APqkfB9P-OIzipQQ.text: Well a friend and I decided to check this place out last night. We went in around 8pm, but never got served. We took two seats at the bar and patiently waited for 10 minutes. A bartender dropped a beer list in front of us and then didn't speak to us again. She served everyone around us but purposely kept skipping us. We weren't really sure why. She seemed to be in a very bad mood. Ultimately we ended up leaving because she definitely wasn't going to speak to us. We were disappointed, their cocktail list looked interesting.

fsrVCjKbXk5VOHtkArZffA.text: This place looks gorgeous but our experience was super disappointing. The boy behind the counter was cold and rude and the drinks he made were weak. I got the breakfast sandwich  and the bacon was chewy and while the eggs were fluffy, they were unseasoned and boring. No water was offered even though it's over 100 degrees outside. Brioche bread was great and the atmosphere looks cool, but that's all this place has going for it. Save your money and skip this spot

90WU1m-82p1bi4pk5Tzsdg.text: I showed up and was expecting this place just to be a coffee house, but when I walked it there was a kitchen, open bar, and a study if I was attending ASU I come here almost everyday to study. It's a nice open environment. You could definitely make friends and meet new people or have a drink or something to eat. It's chill and I like the vibes here.

K3qkgbE5kdJxYeYIJ17bMg.text: Website says late night menu is 10pm-5am. I go in at 1:30am and guy working behind the counter says kitchen is closed. So we asked about the "ghost soda" which is apparently their drink special and the guy behind the counter says "I don't know what that is" either the management is poor or this employee is lazy. Regardless I won't be coming back because of that awkward encounter.

L-FsM1GU9kSepuyRRXS9-g.text: This place is just ok. Decent happy hour deals for $5 drafts and wine but when they billed us we did not have the happy hour deal included. After 20 minutes they finally fixed it and were not very friendly about it. Food was ok but nothing special for the price. Overall we probably won't go back.

Kt2gvPv5kH7munYbFO0FFw.text: Such a cool vibe! I am a big fan of the yummy, dessert type coffee drinks and would've given 5 stars if there was more choices in that category. I can't wait to come back though!

a6XPfiSLyHnKdX7hUFe6UQ.text: A top shelf coffee house. The decor is incredible. Like an old train station with lots of antique light fixtures and furniture. Solid menu and excellent coffee. Would have been a higher review if service was better. Took forever to get our coffee. Barista was not very friendly. Coffee came out like warm. Work on that peeps because your place is really beautiful.

NSwBSO9Dpx2o2rNuM0oWIQ.text: Love the atmosphere during the day to study. At night this is a great spot to stop for a drink. Their beer selection is always awesome.

4Ii6wTrO5I83O8IV8ZjwCw.text: Love this place.  I'm an introvert, so I prefer when it's quiet.  I've been here 3 times now.  Service is incredible.  And they recently opened the kitchen.  Bottom line: get the short rib eggs benedict.  The head chef Jacquelynn is phenomenal.  I will definitely be back.

RrJYPQLUDQTNJXLb51OZqw.text: Always open, serves coffee, adult dranx, and serves munchies? Coconut beer, antique decor, a sick patio.... Cheers y'all

zHbyX370RQYuMAhpQ3uyHg.text: I love this place. I've been here many times over the last 6months. The vibe is relaxing and calm. The people that work here really engage you in. I work from here and I've never been disappointed The food is great the coffee and all its alternatives are amazing.

T3sWQqjpqu6y1CRNe84uLA.text: Literally best place ever. Whether it's spending my time here catching up with friends or doing homework it's a great place to be at. The background music is perfect and just gets you in a good mood regardless of what you are doing. The drinks are also really good, from their chamomile tea to chocolate chai to cocktails . Great atmosphere from the staff and everyone else here. Overall really amazing place!

x9CNMhhiYOlngYknZcTFDg.text: What happened Grand???? You had these comfortable chairs and awesome couches, a fireplace... Went back and all of it was gone! All that's left after hard chairs and tables..... Sucks...I hope this is temporary! But, I will say I had a great mocha here, finally.

l-xeZ1tL4dtfFz9YqfeIyQ.text: Wow - such a cool new place in downtown Phoenix!  We stopped in last weekend for a drink and really enjoyed ourselves - great atmosphere and decor, friendly bartenders and a nice drink menu.  I enjoyed an organic cider that I had never tried before - bonus!  They told me about another cider that was on target to go on tap next and it sounded delicious too.  We'll definitely be back!

m3rebtxiFVEesuS552y8Rg.text: Awesome setup for a coffee spot also great for studying, good vibe and coffees are good. Service was also really good didn't have a chance to try any of the beers or spirits but so far it was a great experience during my visit to AZ.

scmM9hHnMCnCurYArSiGVQ.text: I lalalalove this spot. The decor is top notch, the staff is super friendly and the people here are very diverse and cool. The coffee is pretty good and everything I have had for food here has been great as well. The outdoor patio seating is adorable and the indoor seating features a variety of spots just for whatever occasion you are at a coffee shop for. They have a full service bar if that is what you are looking. There is seating for large groups, individuals, and couples. Upstairs and outside is slightly quieter if that is what you are looking for. Definitely come check out this place for great love music and chill DJ music as well depending on when you are here. I will be here often.

6xFuI3mIAnXiQMq1fHFXpA.text: Plenty of seating and very interesting decorations. I went mid-day looking for a place to study quietly, and that was exactly what I got. Being the tea-girl that I am, there was a moderate list to choose from and the iced rose tea I chose was delicious. The only reason I didn't give a 5/5 rating might have been partly because of me, but I had to drive around the block a couple of times to find the entrance on the other side of the light rail. However, once I found it there was a good amount of parking and I continued to enjoy the rest of my afternoon.

UZcLe8ubbUfv3RxwzEeNcg.text: So The Grand has been open since July of 2016. But I feel that not many people know about it. It's same set up like LUX but twice as big. It's 2 store club that was transformed into a coffee shop/bar/food spot.The lattes are so good here!! Also there building a stage outside for live performance that will be going on Friday nights. Such a chill spot with so many couches and tables to sit at with power outlets to do your work. People here are super chill and quite. The barista here is a previous employee from jobot so he's got all the skill needed to put manic in your cup. Check it out, don't play your self.

FFpykXhuDtHiETkBFGfSZg.text: Great atmosphere, great service, lousy coffee. Decaf was lukewarm/almost cold and tasted like instant. Latte was lukewarm as well. We both had the overnight oats and it was okay but a gut bomb.

e-kAXtxkRB7fKTzbmnIeXw.text: Came in at 2:30AM, told me that the kitchen is closed. Not truly 24/7 is it? I dont recomend this sad excuse of a restaurant.

AzIUxDTBW0bUoekIO6x-fw.text: Late night on a Saturday. Oh, it's actually early morning. It's 1 in the AM to be exactly. I got a Moscow mule and a cauliflower burger. For some reason, they don't taste as great at this hour. But it's great to have this place at this hour. This 24-hour concept might work. It's not NYC but it can be someday.

mDTrX9Old8rWf655sbCJFQ.text: This place is totally a fusion of retro and modern design. It's very easy to get lost in the nostalgic history of this coffee fusion house. The interior is decadent and scrumptious. The manager, Bernadette, was amazing and full of information. Saw this place from across the St and was drawn in by its beautiful facade and design. The coffee was PERFECT and the pastry selection made it very hard to choose only one (so I chose two, a slice of quiche and a zesty lemon vanilla cupcake!) There was a live music show in the ballroom and it was amazing. This is a must try venue. I was totally happy with this place and will definitely be back!

sA1fYbjZnfQCbn2KsXpRYQ.text: It's always a great time at the grand! Excellent food as well as excellent drinks, all the staff is super friendly but both Zoe and Cierra go above and beyond and always make the night the best it could be. They are the reason we keep coming back!

yLTsIZAj9E9z-xeJZqxDyw.text: Kyle is a solid bartender, very attentive, and can keep a good conversation going! I really enjoyed the ambiance of the building inside and out. Considerably wide selection of coffee, beer, food and even teas! Very inviting place!

-AIadS5d4uGB8wZEfVHhLA.text: Very cool place, tons of potential. Our visit today had some highs and lows. We stopped in after a visit to the public market across the street. Their brunch menu starts at 10am and you order food and drinks at the counter. There is no clear line and they probably need more people available to take orders. We got the breakfast sandwich and the BLAT sandwich, house fries, and a peanut butter cookie. I also had some cold brew coffee. The breakfast sandwich was Super yummy; seriously order it! The BLAT came out with out the fried egg, which is a critical part of the sandwich, but they were more than willing to fix it. House fries with aioli were very good. BLAT sandwich was disappointing. My peanut butter cookie was also disappointing: dry and a little overdone (brownish black on bottom). Customer service is friendly and accommodating, it just seems like they need to iron out a few kinks in how they do things in order to speed up service and make it more efficient. Atmosphere is great! Big open space, friendly people. Will be back!

ddAYWAOmVJflcqJGmw7C-w.text: So the food here is five star, the service however is what ruins the experience. That airhead Julian is the worst and talks about the customers as if no one can hear him. When you sit at the bar there is never anyone there to greet you and if someone is they ignore you or stay over by the espresso machines and chat. Maybe both management and the owners either don't care about the costumer service experience or are airheads...like Julian.

6-CahxT-JecdbgLdbn68bw.text: Love the atmosphere of Grand. Friendly. Laid back staff. Love going here.  Without a doubt the best 24hr cafe in town.

rhinYkjYmBuip4eYZMmIWw.text: Great, new spot for 24 hour coffee and bites. Couldn't be happier that not only is there an option that is both open on the weekend and nights, but it's also GOOD! Had one of their huge brownies. Awesome. Had two different types of iced coffee. Awesome. Would definitely recommend this place. Looking forward to coming back and trying everything on the menu.

HOII75E_s26jrrYlnNVRBA.text: Very cool spot! Love the atmosphere and that there is a full bar in addition to the coffee bar. Can't wait to take my dogs to their enormous patio when it gets cooler out!

urZequikZOGKalJwqZ6WHw.text: I've been to The Grand on a few occasions and everytime it's been a great experience. It's a fantastic environment if you're looking for a place to park and get some work accomplished. It's also a perfect spot to have some bites and be social. The drinks are reasonably priced as is the food. I highly recommend their "Grand Burger". The avacado fries are also good, however be prepared as they have a little heat to them.  The staff is extremely friendly and inviting. In particular the bartender, Zoey, was helpful in providing menu suggestions that matched my tastes.  She also makes a really great Moscow Mule.  If you're looking for a place that has a lot to offer The Grand exceeds that endeavor. Outdoor seating, indoor lounging, great coffee, full bar, delicious menu, chill vibe, awesome staff. I love coming downtown for the soul purpose of visiting this business. They're open 24 hours now as well so you can literally check this place out anytime. 5/5

PsBRee7XUlFXmWMgwWJTXg.text: Came here after a d-backs game...all the other bars gave off a club vibe so we were glad we found this place. Their beers were on the warm side...which sucks on a triple-digit hot day. The fries and mac n cheese were good though.

oqBkQkOzwKcMS8-qmrcuQw.text: Gr8. I love it here. However can y'all plz get an air conditioner? It is perpetually hot, I don't know how u employees do it. Anyway, rlly a fan of this place tho 10/10 chai

eBaqAEpl6rH7Gw03NUdZjw.text: Good coffee.  Scramble cold, very over done eggs, toast was the heal of the loaf served without butter or jam.  $1 for coffee refill.

C_H6S_59lCAv8Jwez_lgmg.text: I used to love this place so much, but with the new management, the staff seems frazzled and overworked. I'm still sitting here, 50 minutes later, waiting for three tacos. The WiFi is not working properly. I normally would never complain, but it's been 50(!!!) minutes for THREE tacos. And I think I see them sitting in the window.

8vAZxiec4vUFIM0-YU7knA.text: My newest Downtown Phoenix love. From the outdoor patio to the beautiful interior to the diverse menu and coffee drinks, The Grand offers me everything I would want from a casual study/lunch/dinner/hangout spot. The menu might seem a little pricey for what The Grand offers, but let me assure you:  the portion sizes make it worth the $$. I ordered $3 french fries and felt like I had fries for days. Also the staff has been so good to me. I would continue coming back just to interact with the friendly baristas and wait staff.   What really makes The Grand my favorite place though is the upstairs study lounge. The tables are wonderfully equipped with plenty of outlets and desk lamps, comfortable seating and your food is delivered right to your work space. How can it get any better? Where there is reliable wifi, plenty of coffee, and the ease of ordering a full meal, that is definitely an ideal workspace for me. Did I mention The Grand is 24 hours? I really wouldn't mind pulling an all-nighter here.   Some downfalls would be the weekend brunch menu ~ that is all they will serve during the weekends, so don't expect to get your favorite sandwich and fries combo on a Sunday. Also parking can be a hassle, but they do have their own parking lot!! It just fills up fast if you come on a busy day, keep this in mind!!  Great place, great location. Way to win my heart, The Grand.

kPwtOuGiJ6BiQAZAaOTe2w.text: This place is great! The atmosphere is amazing and was taken back at the friendliness and welcoming environment they curate. I had the closest thing they had to a Carmel frappuccino and it wasn't the best but good enough.  The environment would make me come back for more.

MaDMSM1KOWugTOvSN-lJeg.text: I'll start by saying I have always loved this building, am a huge supporter of local businesses, and rarely leave negative reviews unless something is totally over the top.  When we need a change of scenery from our office, we'll work from various coffee shops (Jobot, Lux & The Grand have been our top 3). It's typically 3-5 of us, and we spend $$$.  Well apparently The Grand is under new management (ownership?) and it sucks! After purchasing a coffee drink & donut for $9, I was greeted with new signs about "laptop-free zones - please study upstairs" and "this table reserved for paying customers" (duh) and new signs on the large COMMUNITY tables saying they're reserved for parties of 6 or more.   So we (begrudgingly) went to a table upstairs. Something is very obviously wrong with their HVAC unit/AC, as it sounded like we were working on a train, our table was literally shaking, and at one point it got so loud and clanky that I seriously thought something might explode or catch on fire, with debris and/or smoke coming out of the vent over us when it finally stopped.  So the 3 of us took our expensive coffee drinks and went downstairs, sitting at the large community table we often sat at pre unfriendly signs, and near a power source. At this point there were maybe 6 people tops hanging out downstairs, with numerous empty tables.  Then Mr. extremely rude, striped shirt Manager walks up to us and asks "Are you expecting more people? Did you read the sign? These tables are reserved for parties of 6 or more people."  I told him we weren't moving because there weren't any parties of 6 to be seen anywhere, he should worry about his about to explode AC unit, that I think the signs and new community table rules are ridiculous, and that he should pass my thoughts on to the owner while I finished my $9 donut & coffee.  So dear owner, you are located a block away from an urban university campus. The area is also full of professionals such as myself who have plenty of expendable income, large networks, and may not want to "study upstairs." This is both ridiculous and insulting when I'm buying your mediocre $5 coffee. This WAS a community and feeling like your new manager is babysitting me (as a 40 something woman business owner) is unacceptable.  We will be taking our business to the friendly establishments where we feel appreciated (or at minimum not harassed) moving forward.

3TnztADET7c_IQAOnbqPMQ.text: Coffee was decent. Food was absolutely awful. Extremely disappointing experience. Spend your money somewhere else downtown.

X8h2cRZwD5x0UHqWGulnsw.text: What a surprise?!! I fully expected this 24 hour joint to be sleepy. There was a great menu, terrific cocktails and efficient service...and the food was actually quite good.

zMI7enh2H9vJg2vWgzvucw.text: It has been mentioned in previous reviews, the two girls who work in the front- barista and bartender need to either be coached or fired. Horrible attitudes and snarls in their faces. Been here multiple times and always notice them. Bartender never smiles and looks absolutely bothered by your presence. Batista switched our drink orders and blamed us for it. Whoever owns this place needs to hire people who understand customer service and smiling.  Drinks were above average, breakfast sandwiches not great. I recommend taco Tuesday if anything.

qK72NW6wLYrg1Xb3NyuRYA.text: I really like this spot! The avocado toast is really good. It's very spacey and has a lot of room and seating for customers. This was definitely my #1 place to study and meet with groups during graduate school. It is an expensive coffeeshop, but the drinks are HUGE for the price that you pay, so it makes it very worth it. The vibe is cute and chill. It's a little far of a drive for me now that I live in Scottsdale and work in Scottsdale, but it is still worth the drive if I want to hang out in DT Phoenix for a bit! :) I definitely recommend this coffee shop. One of my favorites in DT PHX.

DJuJQAxrIzdgFmwZodhp1A.text: This place is awesome! Lots of great details throughout the establishment.  Drinks are wonderful - but pricey, be prepared to spend a little more for them, but worth it.  Very cool vibe and perfect for a downtown feel.  The night club next door gets packed on the weekends, so parking can be difficult. Uber or get a ride so you can enjoy drinks and not worry about parking and drink your drinks! We can back in the morning for breakfast/lunch and it was beautiful! Open 24 hours - stop serving drinks food from 2am--6am (the staff did seem a bit tired on Sunday but who could blame them?!?)

SxL3SqhRffCExLZa5G3Z6Q.text: The Grand is a cool spot, have only been a handful of times though, however the second to the last visit, I ordered a beer and the bartender gave it to another customer, while my last trip I was given another customer's credit card when closing my tab and the bartender response was "I really should start reading the name on these", little alarming...

loJAindzuNxtYGsGIT_Hvg.text: Not busy restaurant- Sunday morning ordered food and thirty minutes later the order was nowhere to be found. Rude bartender who was apparently unwilling to make any recommendations on brunch. He proceeded to take his break with no indicator of my food. Maybe a communication breakdown.   Coffee was excellent and the barista was nice. That's the star.

gBh6_NtxdiRh3Y9s_KgAMw.text: Interesting place! Part bar, part coffee shop, part restaurant, part convenience store. They offer a little bit of everything. We went around 7PM on a Friday (in July) and there was hardly anyone there! Seemed to be mostly students studying, etc. It is pretty dimly lit but the menu boards were lit by black lights which was pretty cool. Very rustic, architecture was unique. Great place!

uKGGc578NT_HIz-evXDFbQ.text: I've made it my mission to check out all the coffee shops that serve adult beverages as well. This place came up on my search. So of course I checked it out. It also helped that many of my elite friends had given it a rave review. They weren't lying. This place was awesome.  I've been to three other coffee shop/bars in town and this one might be my favorite so far. I loved the vintage decore, there was plenty of seating (inside and out), it has two stories and a nice craft beer list. Oh and a happy hour. My pint was only $5.   This might be a stretch but it's kinda like the Disneyland of coffee shops. Not so much as bright and colorful, but tons of cool things to lool at. So hopefully you're not easily distracted.

NieueuXIlpY6G4YlYime5A.text: The Grand is the place to go if you want to have all the experiences in one. The place is beautiful and inspires you to get working on that project or dive in to your favorite book. Want to grab a bite while studying? Check out their extensive menu, I recommend the cauliflower buffalo bites! In the mood for a drink? they have a full bar and a large selection of beers on tap. Need your caffeine fix? Fear no more, full coffee and pastries bar. Also, did I mention is open 24 hours!?  The upstairs area is perfect for studying/working without the distraction of people walking by. Definitely a regular spot for me in Downtown Phoenix!

WDogjNVtYfXyvGzb5p_etg.text: I do enjoy the coffee and the general atmosphere but this place has two MAJOR problems: 1 internet is finicky. Sometimes you can't connect or it will drop you when there are a lot of students there. 2 the music. The music is controlled by whatever barista is there and if the barista wants to treat it like a karaoke bar, no one is getting in their way. I come here to study with a mocha and sometimes some food but whenever they jam the music like it's a clubhouse... at 8 in the morning, I can't get anything done. In conclusion, sometimes it's perfect, other times, it's a nightmare and The Grand has no intention of changing that.

lsJQUSVA2WeHeilFoGftxA.text: The good:  Cool building, location, coffee isn't bad  The bad:  Sadly it is a long list. Parking can be a challenge, the WiFi won't work if there are a busy because they haven't figured out the concept of making their DHCP server hand out more than 255 addresses, something even a novice IT person could solve in about 1 minute.    The place is always cold, when I was here last the temp was 64 degrees.    Bathrooms are not clean, and the last two times I've been here the soap was empty both times.   Food is average quality, but the fries are great.    It's sad, this place could be so much better by fixing the HVAC and turning up the heat a bit, actually fixing your wifi correctly, it's seriously one simple setting in your router.    Clean your bathrooms, empty the trash, put soap in the dispensers.

XMapExe6OUImirkR2U7vvg.text: We popped in for lunch after the place across the street had issues with their registers. The sparse interior is spacious and breezy. The Grand is an order at the counter place and the service is probably best described as "hipster." I ordered the Buffalo cauliflower and fries. I was pretty happy with my sandwich. It was spicy and "meaty." The blue cheese cut the spice well. I didn't feel like the cucumber went with the other flavors. I would have liked a side of fries, but wasn't offered any (only realizing it was an option after watching others get their food) and ended up going back up to order a huge $5 basket.  My friend got the avocado toast and a white chocolate mocha. She was a bit disappointed with the toast--the avocado was brown. The Grand seems like a good place to work and grab a light bite.

Ydhm6XLcUdnw7th_wHgNkA.text: Stumbled upon The Grand, from the outside it doesnt seem like it would be a coffeehouse (I went pretty late at night) It's kinda dark, mysterious, but yet welcoming. The inside is so cool! It has a very vintage underground feel to it and I'm all about it. I ordered an iced dirty almond milk chai. The gentleman that took our order also is the one making the drinks, it took quite a bit waiting in line and waiting for our drink, but it's one guy handling it all so I understood. The drink was good, but I would haven't ordered it if I known ahead of time it was gonna be the powdered chai that one would get at Costco. I would definitely go back and recommend, but I would try a different drink.

photos.caption: Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6d0ShwZ-j3Cz7XnY-5sQ2w.text: The Grand went above and beyond for me! I can't thank the manager, Chris, and the barista/bartender, Ruben, enough. This place used to be a club called Amsterdam. I met my girlfriend there 9 years ago. I decided to take her to The Grand to propose to her. Chris and Ruben helped me pull off one adorable surprise proposal. They played specific music for me that I requested ahead of time. They made a special "marry me" latte and delivered it to our table. They were more than willing to coordinate with me and having their help truly meant a lot to me. Ruben seemed completely ecstatic about being a part of the proposal and even surprised us with some champagne afterwards to celebrate. He made us feel more like his friends rather than customers. Amsterdam has always been a special place to us and now The Grand will forever be a special part of our story.

photos.caption: Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ruben, the barista, made a special latte at my request and it came out absolutely beautiful!!!

dXHqCYrdtNB2m0rxitfuww.text: I used to love The Grand. Granted, I never thought it was the best coffee shop but it always did the job (despite the WiFi being non-existent half the time I came in).  Once classes were out for the summer I didn't come as regularly because I didn't need to study. Also, it's unbearable to be in The Grand during the summer because of the lack of air -- how can you not have a/c in Arizona?  I came in for the first time since summer last week and was met with a menu half the size, prices marked up a bit and no hummus platter. I LOVED the hummus platter and I would get it every time I came in because it was their ONLY vegan option. Their fries aren't even vegan.  I ordered the avocado toast ($8.50... come on) and asked for tomato instead of egg. I don't think they make their bread in house but they should stop ordering it. I couldn't finish the toast (sadly, since I paid too much for it) because it tasted rotten.  Now let's get to today. I ordered an Arnold Palmer with black tea. Repeated my order 3 times when asked what I ordered and still got the wrong drink. I won't even bother asking for a new drink since the girl taking my order was rude and short with me. I tried asking her if there were any vegan options and she just brushed me off saying some $10+ burger was the only thing. The lack of vegan options and customer services (+ no a/c) makes me never want to come back.

PbuY1Y0W2f9pJFEDUB0lIA.text: The ambiance of this place is amazing. I absolutely feel so relaxed here. Friendly and attentive staff, great drinks, and I loved bring my friends here. Will be back!

LQuTYKoaQLgp6WXi4XeuAg.text: This is my favorite spot in Phoenix. Great ambiance, great drinks, great entertainment. The Grand should honestly be the #1 spot downtown.  Seriously, get the food situation figured out. The food here is pretty darned good, but almost every time I've ordered it takes almost an hour to get simple dishes, to the point where I rarely get food anymore. Every time I talk to regulars this is their #1 complaint, which is echoed by the other yelp reviews.   Definitely come here.

Ff_ja_2m7jdEaRxruonMyg.text: Last year I wrote a wonderful review of this place. I am retracting most of it now. Thinking it would be wonderful for my Niece Jasmine's baby shower, I tried to contact them by e mail for over 2 months before I went in person and talked to the ratty haired blond in charge of events. I wanted to have a Gold Coast Theme Gentlemen's area for the father and his party and then a separate area for the mother and hers reminiscent of the 1900s New York Society events. Well I was told NO and given the brush off like I wasn't even welcomed.  Well, I made other accommodations and as a result I would never recommend this place again. There are so many there alternatives that rude treatment like I experienced is never ok. The staff there was disgraceful! If I could give it less than one star I would.

yh-HWAGFha53Je_8zCKb6w.text: Great beer! Loud staff arguing with each other when it's quiet or whatever...? Don't people in the service industry know it's kind of disrespectful? First time back here in 6 months. New staff, different vibe.

IlbdmLBtZkYQbDwzL6CVDg.text: This is going to be a great place.  It's still ramping up, but I stopped by for a coffee this afternoon and was served a perfect macchiato.  Well done!     I'm very encouraged by the investment into this location, and I really hope the owners do well.

Baj8cJ_1RLgFcGjf23Zykg.text: Hey-o rebuttal review any one? This'll probably be one of my first "serious reviews" so I'm making it a plan to counter a bad review to compensate for lack of Jest. (Guess which one?) LET'S GO! Just left Grand. As always, the baristas are great, the service is prompt and the employees never hesitate to check on how things are going. Ordered myself the usual (never disappointing) iced chai along side (you guessed it) AVOCADO TOAST.  The zest to the avocado was tasty and felt like a real pallet cleanser. Couldn't find it in myself to complain about rising avocado prices, being as though that's an actual issue, especially for businesses like the grand. Everyone's gotta profit. I don't mind. I just want the cado. Didn't bring my kid (mostly because I'm 19 and don't own one) but even if I did own a child, I'd make it a point to teach it how to drink water without making a mess AMIRITE LADIES? Any-who, sat at the big round table upstairs. It's great for students like myself, equipped with charging ports for laptop and phone! It IS Pretty wobbly but I'm more of a problem solver and just pulled the ol "righty tighty" on it and adjusted the wobble. I'd like to point out that Grand does an amazing job of being versatile and diverse enough to serve all walks of life. They seem to be opening up a cool new portion downstairs for sorbet, have an upstairs for studying and the outside seating is amazing scene for a night at the bar. (Or I'd assume. What do I know? I'm 19) If diversity isn't enough to sway you on over, take note that Grand continues to be one of the largest/ more spacious coffee/bar joints I've been to in the metro area. That goes a long way with me. :) thanks Grand, for the kick ass service and the kick ass Cado.   Xoxo- Aysia (I miss us. Call me some time?)

O6PtmWM3rsX2ED5X2H1Uqw.text: Oh man, this place is not very good with allergies/dietary restrictions. Ordered the Buffalo Cauliflower after describing that I can't eat dairy products. I was assured it would be okay, but it was served with bleu cheese dressing on a brioche bun, which I can't eat. I sent it back and got avocado toast with the egg removed. However, the bread had butter on it. I already felt like such an annoyance I just stopped eating (luckily didn't experience any health problems) and left. To top it off, the Bell's Two-Hearted IPA I ordered was sour and clearly something was up with it. I gave 2 stars instead of 1 because others who don't have health restrictions might have an easier time.

TAFhjyxiQBEGeb5BxE18xQ.text: Super interesting decor and good food ... BUT .. super SLOW service. Do not come here if you're in a hurry

GvRJMf9PWEMZEsyiTofo2Q.text: Good coffee, GREAT atmosphere. Tons of space, nice employees, great seating options. Seriously: a great hangout or study location. I'm not a coffee snob, I'll leave that review to those who know the trade. Enjoy!

VFYy1hwPqniImV0Ma95rKw.text: Come in at and for the second time in a row their WiFi was down and was told there was nothing they could do. To just wait for it to came back on. What kind of coffee shop is that?

MGLeKtPWHhCDdHmm2A5doQ.text: Wonderful cafe and bar! Very eclectic vibe yet completely relaxed for studying or hanging out with friends. The outdoor and second story seating are very appreciated. My go-to is the lavender latte - it's refreshingly delightful.

dMeB-eixTeHagR5PO1DtPg.text: Love this place. I love that it's open 24 hours and their food is decent and they have a lot of selection for alcohol and coffee. It's awesome for writing.

SJQ3BoSchX0hZdp0lxd-MQ.text: I had heard about this place from a classmate.   One day I finally caved and tried it out.  I find that I cannot study very well at home so I am always looking for places to get my study groove on.  Number 1 positive - it's open 24 hours!!  I can come anytime and it's here.  They have a reverse happy hour and a mini menu for late night sessions.  There is so much space around it's ridiculous and you can spread out as you need to.  They also have plenty of places to charge up, upstairs as well as down.  I have mostly come at night since my hours are off and the crew I've encountered have been super friendly and accommodating.  The only reason not for 5 stars is it can be sorry of dark in the joint.  I don't know how it looks during the day and they do have lamps but it does get a small feel of romantic setting.  Also they play music super loud all night.  That won't stop me from coming though, I can bring headphones to down out the sound and enjoy the space.

DIfhqgls89mOXMKhtWhT3A.text: Perfect place to study or work. Friendly team, good coffee and food, open 24hrs, tons of room. Whether you're writing a paper or coding your next masterpiece, this is the spot. If the parking lot is full, there's usually spots open across the street. Meters are free after 8pm.

rtA2bURMP0ljGb1-1CAdVA.text: Always the best service when I come here. The staff is suuuuper dope and I love the vegan options they have. I ordered the vegan breakfast burrito that has Just Egg, potatoes, vegan cheddar, and soyrizo.... BOMB AF! This was definitely worth the price. They have a selection of alcoholic and non alcoholic beverages along with many artisan coffee and tea selections (with many vegan friendly alternatives). This place also has a market place and is open 24/7. SAY WHAAAAAAT!?!?!   Perfect spot for meeting friends, and winding up or winding down. I'll be back again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan Breakfast Burrito
Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oat milk matcha latte

FpceJR5uQ7f1PhctHzNN8g.text: Do yourself a favor and don't come here. I asked for a veggie burger to go, with avocado. I got my food on a plate and had to box it up myself.  Now mind you their paper machine was down, so I get it they either had to verbalize it or write it down.  So I box up my own food and start walking back to the hotel, I wanted to see if they had remembered my avocado and they hadn't put in there, and it was a meat patty not a veggie patty. I walked right the fuck back, and yes the young man offered to remake it, but how do you get so many things wrong? I simply got my money back and went on my way! Go ahead and go somewhere else!

ndAu62C3dUyrWcWHYY8Itg.text: Great place to grab coffee & get some work done. Whether you're studying or working remotely, this space is perfect (also it's open 24/7)  The biggest draw for me is that their sizes are HUGE, which is perfect for a caffeine addict like myself. They always have interesting/tasty drink specials for those who are a little more adventurous.   & all this coming from a former patron of Amsterdam/Bar On Central!

IcxD6XW-Uocev6zJL2gxyw.text: How can you not love black light lit menus? Or a spooky cafe? What about a rustic, regal, yet gothic mansion of a study space? This is: The Grand!  The coffee, bar, and general store are excellent, staffed with lovely and friendly people that genuinely like working here! Always a good sign. For coffee, I've had a "Butterscotch Latte", and "Lavender White Mocha", and both were excellent! Breanne (bre-an) was the barista and she is very sweet and patient. I was told the baked goods come from a local bakery, Barb's Bakery. I'm always happy when local businesses support each other.  The general store is cool too. They told me the owner brings in really neat items, I for instance saw marble candle holders which were as grand as well, The Grand! haha and I snagged them! Excellently priced as well.   I've always loved The Grand for its atmosphere and drinks and especially its speakeasy "Sanctum" where you can enjoy The Grand's live music from above on Friday and Saturday nights. I only recently came back to try the food and it was not as great as its bar scene unfortunately. I had "The Grand Burger" but the bacon was not cooked all the way. I also had the "Caramel Apple Waffle" but it tasted cheap, I was hoping for a much richer batter like Matt's Big Breakfast's (across the street) Belgian Waffle.   All in all, I'll be back for the coffee, and drinks on the weekend, but I don't think I'll be eating the food anytime soon. Maybe I'll try something from the baked goods case near the baristas but probably won't venture beyond that.

eTE8mj7sLiz-24XW97agsw.text: Excellent place to study or meet friends for coffee.  I ordered a medium sized soy latte.  The cup was very large - yay - and very reasonable.  Flavorful latte! Kudos for having items from local vegan bakeries!   Service was excellent.   Ambiance was excellent.  I will definitely return.

Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious vegan treat from a local bakery.
Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Medium sized iced soy latte.  Delicious and economical for the size.

cJnXouavhc_3jgz0hs9tMA.text: This is one of the best places downtown to grab a coffee and study. The food is good, the atmosphere is good and the service has always been great. On a nice day, their patio is perfect, and has window seating that fronts up against the inside bar.   Did I mention they have cronuts?! Soo good!   The secret doors that lead to backdoor bars and dance clubs are for a separate future review but add to a cool vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Upstairs study area
Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Upstairs

CM0-luorgbfppVLc4IdgVQ.text: This place is definitely different; it has come a long way. The last time I was on the property, it was the gay bar Amsterdam. My, how things have changed over the years, in a good way. It has a hipster, steampunk, study/work area, coffee vibe. That is the only way I can explain it. It is 2 stories and is very open and spacious. They kept the chandeliers from the bar before it, which I love! The coffee and bar area are down in front as soon as you walk in. They then have a ton of different tables on the first floor with plenty of space to work or study; a small kitchen tucked into the back and a small area in the very back that has bottles of different drinks for sale. In the center is a staircase that leads to upstairs. This area is fun. There are a lot of different tables, couches, and chairs for you to relax and read, study or work. I really enjoyed the concept since it is right by ASU, so it gives students an air-conditioned place to study or work.  I had a business meeting here, and it was a great mix for everyone. They have a small menu of food, so we were able to snack, coffee of course for everyone and alcohol for after the meeting. We were here for about 3 hours, and it flew by. We had enough privacy to have our meeting and enough options to mingle, catch-up and get some work done. If I am down in the Phoenix area again or need to plan another meeting out there, I think this is now my go-to spot. Only downfall, small parking lot and you have to drive around the block to get to the parking area. Do not do what I did. It is a one-way street! (insert face into palm) I have had bad luck with that intersection haha! I wish I would have found this place sooner.

2HUwXOL160RcxtLXxZuI_A.text: I was searching for a good place to study and stumbled up on this gem. The food is immaculate... shout out to the kitchen staff James and Deandre for their outstanding service, good job guys. To top it off, my laptop was dead and I couldn't find a table with an outlet, but this angel, Leah, found me a nice and cozy table upstairs with not one, but several outlets... lol .... thanks Leah

a2hSbyQ2a1X9YQPU49NWbQ.text: Absolutely INCREDIBLE experience. Phenomenal atmosphere, service, and food. I ordered the Buffalo Cauliflower, and it was out of this world. One of the chefs, DeAndre, came to check on us and our meal. Great service, delicious food, what more could you need? Would recommend this to anyone, and definitely coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aFODp9pUhPGAMzjTzTXFhw.text: Phenomenal experience dining at The Grand. The service staff was incredibly friendly and provided a warm atmosphere. I ordered the Mac n' cheese burger with sweet potato fries and I had no negatives to say about my food. The sweet potato fries especially were the best I ever had, a pleasant light crisp on the outside with an inside that had the consistency of mashed potatoes. I had the pleasure of meeting D'Andre who was the chef and made me feel like I was eating food he was passionate about, and no qualms about it he should be proud of his work.   I'm coming again when I'm downtown next time for sure.

AYyW6xh-esI7sS1Gq97tFA.text: What a neat place to hang out!!  Stopped in to check out the speakeasy "Sanctum" and decided not to go inside since there was a $20 cover charge.   Instead I grabbed a drink at the bar inside The Grand and just soaked-up the live music.  Inside there is a balcony which is perfect for sitting and watching the eclectic patrons come and go.   This isn't really a jumping night-life spot but a perfect place to just sit and relax, it's a definite place to check out!!!

vXmbHu-xy9ZEGPR8vqIaxQ.text: Very neat place. I love the atmosphere and architecture. The servers were friendly. They have vegetarian options and the cauliflower pineapple teriyaki was amazing! The drinks were pretty and tasted great! I will have to visit again sometime.

mFa_med2EOH8KTCSZtF-5Q.text: Went from an awful service experience down the road so when we stepped into this place for a beer we were so relieved to find really lovely and just really warm and friendly bartenders and baristas. Every employee we came in contact with was absolutely lovely and seemed like they actually enjoyed people and their job.   Their draft beer selection is awesome (especially for IPA lovers) and the patio is so cozy and shaded and spacious. We had our 2 year old with us and the guy who rang up her creamsicle asked if he could make her a chocolate milk on the house. It was just an overall really lovely experience and we can't wait to come back!

IhXlLVjfJRBd1wn67znBWg.text: I was so bummed that the food here was not good. I ordered the mac and cheese burger with the veggie patty (so did my 2 friends, who were also disappointed). There was no seasoning on the burger what so ever and the onion rings were not cooked all the way. I did like their coffee and pastries but I'm almost certain they buy them from an outside vendor. Such a bummer for such a cute place, they really need to step it up when it comes to the food if they're going to want to keep this place around. If I'm paying $15 for a burger, at the very least I expect it to have some seasoning on it.   Also, the two girls working the kitchen were rude and non-attentive to most guests I saw them interacting with.  Save your money and go to PHX Wilderness or Angels Trumpet Ale House, they for sure will not let you down.

kGNFfAFtg1tviAqH96sXRA.text: The Grand deserves all the stars out there, because it is just what it's name says...it's pretty darn GRAND.  I am so thankful I was introduced to this place. A 24/7 coffeeshop/eatery/outdoor patio/study atmosphere/hangout/bar place! Seriously, what can get better than that?  Ambience-   Inside: I'm the type of person who likes a little background noise while studying so this place was my ideal arena. I came here on a Sunday afternoon for a good two hours, ordered a flat white and sat at a table and peacefully studied for the GRE. There's an upstairs with more privacy and enclosed areas with lighting and smaller tables for one person. The downstairs has larger tables for group hangouts/group study.   Outside: You can sit at the large wood bench-type seating at the outside patio that is SHADED and beautifully surrounded by plants and trees! I always love to see the anomaly of greenery in AZ (although I do love the desert vibes as well). There are also small tables and chairs to sit at outside.   Food/Drinks-  The food menu is diverse ranging from burgers, mac and cheese, salads, and soup. The coffee menu is pretty unique but at the same time standard with your cold brew, latte, etc.  Alcohol Bar: They have a decent sized bar right when you walk in and I noticed on the Sunday that I was there that couples and groups of friends came in to grab a drink at the bar and leave soon after to continue day-drinking. I mentally took a note of doing that with a group of girl-friends one day, too. Great idea! ALSO, their drink menu is super fun, they have strawberry basil margaritas!? say YUM.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND: I'm excited to go back to this place at night for a night-cap, but also to study some more and order food. I think this is the perfect place for people who are hiring to take their interviewees here if you are giving more of an informal interview. You can grab either/both coffee/food/drinks and sit down in a more private table upstairs or if you need a little bit of noise, sit downstairs!  Pics on Instagram: @deeps.eats

X3IZbJ1PABfb0LCcv3IeLg.text: I stumbled across The Grand on my recent desert sojourn, and I am frankly shocked by the number of negative reviews on here. If I lived in Phoenix, I would patronize the The Grand daily.   The coffee is some of the best I have ever had; it evoked the memory of the high quality cafe con leche I used to get when I lived in Spain. To use an analogy, The Grand's coffee is to Starbucks coffee, as Starbucks coffee is to gas station coffee.   The food is good too. I had an opportunity to sample both the breakfast sandwich, with their house aioli, and the Grand's take on the BLT (the BLAST). I recommend both unequivocally.    Good coffee and good food make a good cafe. What makes The Grand great is its combination with beer. Such a place like this does not exist in the national capital region (if it did, I hope that I would've found it by now). The Grand actually has good craft beer (I'm specifically thinking of Wren House Brewing, which I was unable to find anywhere else while I was in the desert).   As for my fellow Yelpers' complaints about the internet, there did not appear to be any issues when I was there. Plenty of people were whittling the day away on their laptops.

mKuac9ZLt505KRC49snLnA.text: First time I came for an early dinner. My first impression was that it was pretty dark inside, but the place is gorgeous and has a classic speakeasy feel to it, even in cafe forms.  As always, I got my chai latte, here with almond milk and almond syrup. I enjoyed good flavor, just the right amount of foam and the perfect temperature. Weirdly, though, they gave me a disposable cup when I didn't order to go. Save a tree, Grand staff! This was so good I've already returned for it once. Staff are friendly in the mornings and the donuts are delicious, especially warmed up.  Outside of breakfast, my order of avocado toast was sadly disappointing. It felt like there was no seasoning at all. You can make an amazingly flavorful toast with just smashed avocado, a sliced boiled egg, and some greens, but you have to involve at least salt and pepper.  Finally went for a drink last night and I was disappointed again. It was still early on a Friday night and they weren't busy by any means. The cocktail menu looks great, but I spent $15 on a drink that mostly tasted like soda water. Looks like this place is relegated to being a breakfast stop only.

photos.caption: Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Il2gOV-Q5o7S2yx8IBgPsg.text: My vanilla latte was delicious. The study nooks abound here! You can study outside or on the top or bottom floors. The lighting is a bit dim but I think that's for the vibe. There's food and drink for everyone here and it's open 24/7!

photos.caption: Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vanilla latté

vVva6luNnaVT3jltKjR_Ug.text: I'm not going to bother reading what negative reviews could possibly exist for this place. It needs all the support it can get.   Phoenix finally has a GOOD 24/7 coffee shop that serves excellent-quality food (recommend the grand burger or impossible burger and sweet potato fries).  It is also styled like a 20's speakeasy with wrought iron, wood, repurposed gears, has a ginormous patio, two floors of seating indoors and outdoors, and is one of the few places downtown with good parking.   protip: learn how to enter the parking lot from the back after your first time there.   top tier pastries and baked goods, the donuts rock (get it warm)  fantastic teas and great coffees and espresso drinks  the baristas and bartenders are genuinely friendly   the WiFi can be temperamental the further you get from the router like normal   Mac and cheese of the moment - a chef special take on their already incredible homemade mac and cheese   skip weekend nights if you want to study or work - it shares walls with a goth club called sanctum. they also sometimes have live music on the grand patio for weekend nights.   full bar featuring absinthe! why is every review not 5 stars? I'm not even done.  on top of all of this, there is, for some reason, a fully functioning market / store in the corner with its own entrance, menu, and sundries. they sell cereal, snacks, and lunch time stuff.   being inside this place doesn't magically not make you in downtown Phoenix - use common sense at night and take the normal precautions for being in urban areas at night.   their menu is 24/7. I should have both lead and ended with that.

photos.caption: Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rAA_GE45Hgaq5ssGvdHfuA.text: This place is THE best coffee place I've been to. They're very welcoming and friendly. They have an upstairs platform so students and work quietly. It's open 24 hours and the food there is AMAZING. I went here with my family once and my brother got a burger and he said Hands down one of the best burgers he's had. If you're looking for a place to study and eat some amazing food this is the place to go, and the food is worth the price. Definitely go if you're looking for a nice place to study all night.

ZbWWi8lIf9b1S-3w09Fb0w.text: I definitely love the atmosphere, excellent drink choices and now food. If it were permissible I pretty sure I would live here. By far my favorite place to get specialized beverages. Their Scotch and Cigars cocktail is exquisite. Seating it plentiful, my only one complaint is ever since the opening of the kitchen it has become a little too hot to sit inside during the summer.

Pmkcn9t6OzLbBa4DW8aGIw.text: I only tried a soy chai tea. It was more than generous fill for the cup. It's sweetness is perfect, not too much and not too little. I did not like it tho since it smelled liked a cough syrup. I did not like how loud the music is since I went there for studying. Even though I wore a Bluetooth earbuds, but still heard the noise. Around 3, it was the time that kids got out of school and there was more noise beside the music. I couldn't finish my project and had to change the place.   The decorations and the sittings are varied and an all comfortable levels. The restrooms are nice and clean. There are a parking lot behind the location and meter ones around it.

fy1rWhuP38yUz0cS_VNTeg.text: I hesitate to even give this place a single star. We tried to sit outside and they told us they only serve inside. We sat inside for 10 minutes and eventually realized we had to go to a counter to order. When we went to the counter the woman there literally had no idea what was in any sort of dish, even the side salad. She couldn't give recommendations and ordering took literally 15 minutes because any simple question we had she couldn't answer. The service here was extremely subpar. We were the only group of 3 orders in the restaurant and it took 20 minutes to deliver very subpar food. I will never come back here.... or if I'm forced to again I will not order due to the horrendous service and wait time.

8GKbgIfjw_IL8yTxz8xWzw.text: I WANT to like this place. Location, vibe, great patio, good beer selection. but i CANNOT get past the service and general malaise of the staff. It's almost like you are disturbing the work with the inconvenience of ordering something. which SUCKS, because the food is really good! My guess is that it is a perfect millennial hang out, (which I clearly am not a member of) low ability to interact, severe entitlement, and you can stay for hours without being bothered. I dunno, given the competition for coffee shops downtown, a few minutes of training would go a long way to putting this place on my rotation. DO BETTER!!!

NhpCIAVIOdZxFzWIM2C2MA.text: The service is horrible! The girl with the grey Zombie hair is rude and her BRF needs to be surgically removed. The burgers are great! Nice atmosphere.

PA6d-0PJmuBI7cuZK7pjoA.text: I'm giving this two stars because the food here was not very good. I got the grand burger which was not so bad, but I ordered fries and they were disappointing. They were so hard and I felt like they were stale. I also got a strawberry lemonade which was way too sour and sweet. The place itself though was very pleasing but the food was not.

9cHNtXuRCLHMZ3UWD-fEYw.text: I visited my family in the area about 2 mons ago n the food we had was amazing!! Fresh produce, meat etc. It seemed like the meal was made just for us, on the spot! I was so impressed! I recently came back to your establishment within the last week, expecting the same freshness n brightness with the food, but to be honest, I was much less than impressed! Seemed like frozen vegetables left out to thaw and water logged. Same for the meat! I honestly felt embarrassed bragging to my friends and family in the area how amazing the food was at this restaurant for them to tell me, it seemed like fast food quality... not sure what changes you have made but please go back to ur summer time quality!

4A2YpjfI_koqpQx2TaomEA.text: My friend and I walked in here and immediately felt so welcomed by Zoe and Alyssa, the bartender and barista! They were so sweet, attentive and personable and made us delicious drinks. The customer service was wonderful and we'll definitely be back!

JK5bgD3rQs3BHNqKYBFrJQ.text: I usually love coming here , the coffee combos are the best.! But lately the coffee baristas have been having bad attitudes and seem stuck up. . It makes me very uncomfortable and ruins my visits. Sucks because I really enjoy coming  here.

eXDRMorbj5Q2nBr3qCbk1Q.text: I've been to the grand about 4 times. The first time I went there I was intrigued by how different it looked than any other place I've stopped to grab a snack. I try not to write a bad reviews on places because I know sometimes days go bad. However, all four times i have came the customer service hasn't been the best. I also haven't had very good experience with their food my burger was pretty much burnt, as well as my order was forgotten. I waited while my family received their food. Might be a good place for drinks but not if you want good customer service....

5YNwaeJq4JIL6gj6AmYy3w.text: Had to see this place in person upon reading an article about its' new opening and I was not disappointed, though it was late so I did not try out the coffee I give the atmosphere and staff 5 stars, very cool place, I will be returning to  try the coffee upon my return to Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bLu0wuIgyxVCxhaWkPm3Vw.text: I love the simplicity of this place. The fact that it is open all hours is a plus.  A great place to stop for a bite or just hangout with friends. The food is really good!

Lm0wWD7QFNaJM2E4r05Oyg.text: This place is a great place to study!  It's spacious, and relaxing!  Their interior design is cool too, feels like you are in a coffee shop in NYC.   I've hung out at the bar with a friend as well... there is not much of a variety of drafts but the bar tender was very friendly and offered us the many other varieties of mix drinks they had to offer .  I definitely recommend this place for meetings , studying time, or just catch up with a friend .   The location is pretty tricky to find.. the "light rail" separates the location, and "the one way" ,  tricks me into going to del Soto coffee shop down the street instead ...  I recommended giving this place a shot!

hDaHBhha3WI0uZIY_84Iog.text: One of the best coffee shops I've been to, and I've been to many!  First and most important to me, this coffee shop is *huge* and has amazing support for remote workers. Large tables, plenty of power outlets (and I mean plenty!), and too many nooks and crannies to hide yourself in to count.  The menu is fantastic any time of day. You can get a scotch & cigar and 4am in the morning -what a treat! I recommend trying the "Mac of The Day," which is a different take on macaroni each day. (Some have included: pot pie macaroni, buffalo chicken, etc)  I really enjoy the bar options as well. Plenty on tap and specialty drinks. It's the only place I've been able to find a good lambic/sour beer (coming from Chicago where they are plentiful, I've been sad!)  Service is a little slow times, but that's to be expected with the large interest in this place.  Check out some of the pictures too. This place is BEAUTIFUL, both outdoors and inside. 10/10, if I had a coffee shop, this is exactly what it would be.

EGWQvfFIqMMSpLgmFurYyA.text: I stopped into this new coffee shop today after reading about it on AZ Central. I was excited to see what they did with the old Amsterdam bar.. When I arrived, I found it a little difficult to park because it's located on a one way street ...so for everyone trying to park, make sure that you go South one street to pierce and then turn into the small road to the left side of the light rail so that you can turn into their parking lot. The place has very cute decor, with clocks showing the time  in different parts of the world(you know, grand central themed). They have a loft area upstairs and ample seating downstairs (the perfect place to hang out and study or chat with friends). The staff were all friendly and helpful. They source their coffee from infusion coffee and tea in Tempe and get their chai from David Rio. Essentially the drinks here are like the drinks at infusion Coffee and Tea (aka delish), but far closer to my house (even better). They also have a full bar and many beer taps (a variety of local and nonlocal craft brews at a decent price point). Their happy hour right now is from 11 to 7...most excellent. I know I will be making many return trips to Grand Central and recommend you do the same!

photos.caption: Photo of The Grand - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer list

C36AlQ6NfLwKYseGbH5Ing.text: Went there for the first time. The barista at the register didn't acknowledge us. Stood there for a while before we were helped by someone else. Definitely didn't feel welcomed.   Besides the service from this particular barista, the place has a cool vibe, and good coffee (caramel latte).

50UyjhP9Xt2YTOqE9KCuzg.text: Okay. So first off the we have a coffee shop downtown with an amazing floor plan of space and seating. Open till midnight during the week, weekends they go untill 2am they have amazing coffee not to mention a full bar with over 23 amazing beers on draft! Honestly please come check them out located in the heart of downtown with a awesome atmosphere and good vibes. Cheers
